option to activate cropping under shelter: 1 = no, 2 = yes
option to calculate mountain climate taking into account the orientation: 1 = south, 2 = north
option to activate the calculation of the climate in altitude: 1 = no, 2 = yes
option to activate the direct effect of N plant status on the fruit/grain number: 1 = no, 2 = yes
option to activate the effect of N stress on root partitioning within the soil profile: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate leaf removal by thinning: 1 = proportion of leaf removed (effeuil), 2 = lai minimal (laieffeuil)
option to calculate the inflorescences number: 1 = read in param.par, 2 = calculated at the amf stage
option to calculate topping: 1 = forced topping, 2 = automatic calculation
option to define harvest type: 1 =single harvest (cutting), 2 = multiple harvests (picking)
option to activate the simulation of Nitrogen and Carbon reserves: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to define profres: 1 = profres read in tec file, 2 = profres calculated as proftrav *(1-exp(-resk.(proftrav-resz))
option to activate the simulation of 2 root classes: 1 =yes, 2 = no
option to activate the effect of temperature on development units for emergence according to Wang et Engel (1998): 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate dynamic calculation of residual LAI, biomass and N content after cutting: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate hourly WFPS calculation for denitrification: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate hourly WFPS calculation for nitrification: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the preferential allocation of biomass to roots in case of water or N stress: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to define the denitrification potential: 1 = read in soil parameter, 2 = calculated from soil organic carbon concentration
option to define the N2O/(N2+N2O) ratio of denitrification: 1 = constant, 2 = variable
option to define the N2O/(N2+N2O) ratio of nitrification: 1 = constant, 2 = variable
option to define the temperature function for nitrification: 1 = piecewise linear, 2 = gaussian
option to define the nitrification rate dependence on NH4: 1 = first order, 2 = Michaelis-Menten
option to activate the mulch effect at soil surface: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the harvest according to grain/fruit water content: 1 = water content > minimum threshold, 2  = water content < maximum threshold
option to calculate water requirements: 1 = k.ETP approach, 2= resistive method
option to calculate chilling requirements: 1 = no need, 2 = vernalising days, 3 = development stage
option to take into account pebbles in the water and N balances: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the automatic calculation of fertilisation rate: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the automatic calculation of irrigation requirements: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the use of crop temperature for phasic development calculation: 1 = empirical relation, 2 = energy balance
option to simulate fruit removal: 1 = no, 2 = yes (for smallest fruits)
option to activate climate change: 1 = no, 2 =yes
option to activate the dynamic calculation of CsurNsol: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the beginning and the ending dates in case of automatic irrigation: 1 = dates, 2= crop stages,  3 = nothing
option to calculate irrigation dates according to sum of temperatures: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate mineral fertilizer application dates according to sum of temperatures: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate moisture and frost effects on harvest decision: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the moisture effect on harvest decision: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the calculation of denitrification model: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate dormancy and chilling requirements: 1 = forcing, 2 = Richardson, 3 = Bidabe
option to define root profile in soil: 1 =  standard root distribution, 2 = root emission proportional to root biomass
option to activate the variations in physical soil conditions due to tillage: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to define the number of compacted soil layers: 1 = one layer, 2 = two layers
option to activate the soil compaction at sowing and harvest: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate the module simulating tillers dynamics: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate PET: 1 = forced Penman, 2 = calculated Penman, 3= Shuttleworth & Wallace, 4 = Priestley & Taylor
option to activate cuts of forage crops: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate an additional water compartment for swelling soils: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate plant thinning: 1 = no, 2 = yes
option to calculate the maximal symbiotic fixation: 1 = fixed value read in the plant file,  2 = depends on growth rate
option to activate split applications of N fertiliser: 1 = absolute value, 2 = fraction of total N application
option to define the maturity status of the fruits in the variable CHARGEFRUIT: 1 = including ripe fruits (last box N),  2 = excluding ripe fruits (first N-1 boxes)
option to define the effect of soil nitrate on N fixation: 1 = no effect, 2 = effect of nitrate amount, 3 = effect of nitrate concentration
option to define the time step used for calculating development units: 1 = hourly, 2 = daily
option to define the time step used for calculating bud break date: 1 = daily, 2 = hourly growing degrees
option to simulate germination: 1 = germination phase, 2 = immediate germination
option to activate water stress effect on crop growth: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to simulate plant emergency: 1 = phase of hypocotyl growth (sown crops),  2 = plantation of plantlets
option to simulate the type of leaf growth and fruit growth: 1 = determinate, 2 = undeterminate
option to activate reset of initial conditions in case of chained simulations: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to compute NNI: 1 = cumulative NNI, 2 = instantaneous NNI
option to activate N stress effect on root length growth: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to simulate rainfall interception by leaves: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate the ratio grain weight/total biomass: 1 = proportional to time, 2 = proportional to thermal time
option to simulate perennial crops destruction
option to calculate the intercepted radiation according to: 1 = LAI, 2 = soil cover
option to define if the crop is a legume fixing N: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to activate calculation of water flux in soil macroporosity: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate hourly microclimatic outputs (output file humidite.sti): 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to simulate a bare soil with a constant water content: 1 = yes, 2 = no

option to define the type of plant: 1 = monocot, 2 =dicot
option to stop the reserve limitation after stem elongation in grassland: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to calculate the mass of dead roots after a cut: 1 = based on masec, 2 = based on masectot

option to activate the nitrification model: 1 = yes, 2 = no

option to write outputs files with scientific format: 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to define soil cover: 1 = no cover, 2 = plastic cover partly covering the soil
option to define if the plant is fixed onto a vertical support: 1 = no, 2 =yes
option to define the crop perenniality: 1 = annual crop, 2 = perennial crop
option to define plant photoperiodism: 1 = yes, 2 = no
simulation of the effect of decreasing photoperiod on biomass allocation : 1 = yes, 2 = no
option to define the coding name of the plant (3 characters)
option to define N requirements at the beginning of the cycle: 1 = dense plant population, 2 = isolated plants

option to simulate several successive USM: 0 = no, 1 = yes

option to define automatic N fertilisation calculation: 1 = based on rainfall, 2 = based on soil water content

option to calculate radiation interception: 1 = Beer law, 2 = radiative transfer
option to activate heat effect on grain filling: 1 = yes, 2 = no
